intro: Heterotheca correllii, commonly known as the plains coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to the central and southern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as prairies, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in full sun. Its yellow-orange flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators including bees and butterflies. Heterotheca correllii is also known for its hardy nature and ability to withstand drought conditions.
